title: Mythical Creatures
description: Test your knowledge of Greek monsters and beasts!

questions.question: What is Cerberus?
questions.explanation: Cerberus is the three-headed dog that guards the entrance to the underworld.

questions.question: What happens when you look at Medusa?
questions.explanation: Medusa was a Gorgon whose gaze turned anyone who looked at her into stone.

questions.question: The Minotaur had the head of a bull and body of a man.
questions.explanation: The Minotaur was a creature with a bull's head on a human body, trapped in the Labyrinth of Crete.

questions.question: What is a Cyclops?
questions.explanation: Cyclopes are giant beings with a single eye in the middle of their forehead.

questions.question: What is Pegasus?
questions.explanation: Pegasus is a divine winged horse that sprang from Medusa's blood when Perseus killed her.

questions.question: What creature has the head of a woman and body of a lion with wings?
questions.explanation: The Sphinx asked riddles and devoured those who couldn't answer. Oedipus solved her riddle.

questions.question: Centaurs are half-human and half-horse.
questions.explanation: Centaurs have the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse.

questions.question: What do Sirens use to lure sailors to their doom?
questions.explanation: Sirens sang irresistible songs that lured sailors to crash their ships on the rocks.
